title: What are the negative and positive effects of a high-level technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: This Generation is very lucky as we have all comfortable things to lead a Happy Life with respect to Technology, Food, Environment and All essential requirements. When it comes to Technology, As the world is moving very fastly with Technological growth, we are leading a very comfortable life and everything is on fingers. We can get anything what we want just through a Digital sources like our Mobile phones. These are the Positive effects of High level Technology. But at the same time, By increasing Technology, Mankind neglecting Environment, and not nurturing Environment in a way it requires. And some of the inventions, directly harmful to the Environment. As we are neglecting Nature, world is going through a tough time of adverse effects from Nature. These are Negative effects of high level Technology. No worries. Still we have a time. If we are conscious and responsible towards nature, and Protect our Environment. Along with if we educate our next generation to protect the Environment, and if we use high- level technology in a responsible way, Technology is really a boon to the people. Cauvery Calling. Positive: Quality of human life increases. Humans are forced to learn, adapt, grow intellectually and perhaps physically. The environment around us suffers less damage and restores to unspoiled status.. Negative: Change itself causes damage. Humans and environment die from growth spurts of failed or unworkable high technology. Some areas and situations never recover and are gone forever. If you think this is a bit crazed, think on a future technology where mankind has the ability to create and move matter. We can already do it on a very small scale, but with high technological advancements in transportation (teleportation?!) and engineering you could literally build mountains, restore the salinity of an entire ocean, and genetically recreate deceased former life (honeybees, heath hens, whatever). 150 years ago it was people riding horses to send information. 15 years ago you could see someone on a large screen or talk to them in a small portable phone. Today, I can talk to you in person on a small square screen in real-time. Imagine 150 years from now.
